content: Hello! Thanks for contacting XYZ Home Services. My name is Ava. How can I assist you today? May I please have your name to get started?
Yeah, whatever. It's Dorothy. My living room lights keep flickering. Can you send someone and tell me how much this is gonna cost? I'm not paying a fortune.

Thank you, Dorothy. Sorry to hear about the lights! Could you please share your address so I can check if you're within our service area? And I’ll do my best to get you a price estimate once I have more details.
It's 420 Pinecrest Drive. Don’t give me any nonsense fees! Just tell me up front what this is going to run me.
Thank you, Dorothy. Let me quickly check if Pinecrest Drive is within our service area.

Good news, Dorothy—you're within our service area! I understand pricing is important to you. Would you like a general estimate for troubleshooting living room flickering lights? If the issue is more complex, the technician might need to provide a more specific quote in person.
Don’t try to upsell me. I’m sick of these hidden fees. Just tell me how much for someone to come fix it. Are you going to charge me just to show up? Last place tried to pull that on me.

Thank you for sharing your concerns, Dorothy. I want to be as transparent as possible. Would you like a price estimate for the service call and basic troubleshooting? If additional repairs are needed, the technician will discuss those and obtain approval before any work is done.

Our standard visit fee for this type of issue is $79, which covers the inspection and diagnosis. If the fix is simple, often that’s all you pay. We’ll get your approval for anything beyond that. Does that sound okay, or would you like more details?

$79 just for someone to walk in the door? That’s ridiculous! Last time it was $50. You’re all the same—just trying to squeeze money out of people. What’s your cheapest rate? Don’t dance around this, just answer.

I completely understand your frustration, Dorothy. Our service fee covers the thorough inspection and diagnosis by qualified electricians. Unfortunately, $79 is our standard rate for all customers; we don’t have a cheaper service call option. Is there anything else I can clarify, or would you like to go ahead and schedule?
No, this is a ripoff. $79 just to tell me I need even more work. Forget it. I’m not paying that. Take me off your list. Don’t text me again.
reason: Customer requested not to be contacted.

content: I understand, Dorothy. I’ve removed your number from our contact list and you will not receive any further messages. If you ever need assistance in the future, we’re here to help. Have a great day.
reason: Customer requested not to be contacted.
